contentrichtext.text: {{Refimprove|date=December 2010}} '''Voice Crack''' was a [[Switzerland|Swiss]] electronic [[free improvisation]] group. Formed in late 1972 by Andy Guhl and Norbert MÃ¶slang, Voice Crack were initially a [[free jazz]] duo. They began incorporating pre-recorded tape effects and live sound processing, and by 1983 they eliminated any normal instrumentation in favor of what they call "cracked everyday electronics:" Mundane objects such as "[[radio]]s, [[phonograph|turntable]]s, transmitters, [[dictaphone|dictating machines]]" and other items are cracked open and manipulated to produce "new sounds using magnetic and radio waves in a complex system controlled by movements of their hands and by light."<ref>[http://www.for4ears.com/poire_z/about_poire_z.html For4ears.com]</ref> The resulting music - which consisted of various overlapping buzzes, clicks, [[Drone (music)|drones]] and oscillations - has been described as, "Cascading magnetic waves arc across the sky as three-headed critters race and rummage through alien flora ... or at least that's what it sounds like.";<ref>[http://www.erstwhilerecords.com/catalog/reviews/011_review.asp Erstwhilerecords.com]</ref> and was favorably compared to some of [[John Cage]]'s work.<ref>[http://www.allmusic.com/cg/amg.dll?p=amg&sql=A4ckmu3rkan8k Allmusic.com] {{Dead link|date=January 2011|bot=CactusBot}}</ref> Voice Crack collaborated with [[Borbetomagus]], [[Butch Morris]] (as part of a larger ensemble), and were members of [[poire z]]. The group has now disbanded. ==References== {{Reflist}} [[Category:Free jazz ensembles]] [[Category:Musical groups established in 1972]] [[Category:Swiss electronic music groups]] [[Category:1972 establishments in Switzerland]]
